data.title: A Complete List Of Every Game Boy Advance Game
data.meta_description: The complete list of all the Nintendo Game Boy Advance and SP games ever produced for the GBA. How many of these classic games do you still own?
data.text:
The complete list of every Nintendo Game Boy Advance SP games ever produced for the GBA. The Game Boy Advance and Advance SP consoles are among the most popular portable game systems of all time. Nintendo GBA games were produced by hundreds of developers, and most GBA games featured state-of-the-art graphics for a handheld and also featured the first color graphics on a portable system.

The Game Boy Advance still has a strong following thanks to the DS having a GBA slot for backwards compatibility. Feel free to use these list items to start a list of your favorite Game Boy Advance games.

Ranked by

Genres (Video game) : Action-adventure game

Embark on a timeless journey in The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past, where players control series protagonist, Link, in his quest to rescue Princess Zelda and thwart the evil wizard Agahnim. What sets this installment apart is its unique dual-world mechanic, cleverly intertwining the familiar Hyrule with the darker, parallel world of the Sacred Realm. Iconic features like the Master Sword and Pegasus Boots make their debut here, further enriching the already robust gameplay. With challenging dungeons to conquer, memorable characters to interact with, and a sprawling overworld to explore - this title remains a standout in the storied franchise.

Pokémon Ruby and Sapphire

2002

Genres (Video game) : Console role-playing game, Adventure, Role-playing video game

Get ready to catch 'em all in the vivid region of Hoenn with Pokemon Ruby and Sapphire. These third-generation titles introduce a plethora of new features including 135 new Pokémon, innovative double battles, and engaging weather mechanics. Dive into the immersive story, as players take on the role of Pokémon trainers seeking to thwart the nefarious plans of either Team Magma or Team Aqua (depending on the version selected). With dynamic gameplay, an unforgettable soundtrack, and rich environments to explore, these games leave a lasting impression within the beloved Pokémon universe.

The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap

Nov 04 2004

Genres (Video game) : Action-adventure game, Action game

Experience a captivating adventure in The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap as Link partners up with a magical talking hat, Ezlo, in order to save the kingdom of Hyrule from the evil sorcerer, Vaati. This action-packed title boasts a unique shrinking mechanic, allowing players to become minuscule and interact with the world from a whole new perspective. Unlock different items, like the Gust Jar and Cane of Pacci, to solve intricate puzzles and defeat formidable foes. With its vibrant visuals, enchanting story, and engaging gameplay, The Minish Cap delivers an unforgettable handheld gaming experience.

Genres (Video game) : Action game, Simulation video game, Racing video game

Rev your engines and hit the track in Mario Kart: Super Circuit, featuring 20 classic and new racing circuits across four speed classes. Stand out within the racing genre due to its whimsical characters from the Mario series, balanced item system, and addictively fun gameplay, this title remains a fan favorite for casual and competitive players alike. Test your mettle in various game modes, like Time Trial, Quick Run, and the ever-popular Battle Mode. With tight controls, challenging courses, and endless replayability, Mario Kart: Super Circuit continues to shine as a pinnacle of portable racing fun.

Genres (Video game) : Tactical role-playing game

Strategy and intrigue collide in Fire Emblem, the first entry of the renowned franchise to grace Western shores. Players control a colorful cast of characters, each with distinct strengths and weaknesses, as they navigate a richly-detailed fantasy world fraught with political turmoil. This turn-based tactical RPG innovates the genre by introducing a permadeath feature, raising the stakes and making every decision count. With deep character development, intricate gameplay mechanics, and an engaging story, Fire Emblem is an essential experience for fans of tactical role-playing games.

Genres (Video game) : Tactical role-playing game, Action game, Role-playing video game, Strategy video game

Command your clan to victory in Final Fantasy Tactics Advance, a masterful blend of turn-based strategy and JRPG elements set in the enchanting world of Ivalice. Its standout feature, the Law System, challenges players to plan their moves carefully while navigating an increasingly complex web of restrictions to ensure success in battle. Choose from a diverse array of classes, like the agile Ninja or mystical Summoner, and customize your team to create an unstoppable force. Featuring an engrossing story and captivating gameplay, Final Fantasy Tactics Advance remains a beloved staple of the Game Boy Advance library.
